bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Wickliffe Rose, October 8, 1918

div1.p: [Carter] writes that he does not have case records from Guiteras' report and that the report did not encompass yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Wickliffe Rose, October 8, 1918
div1.opener:
Petersburg, Va., Oct. 8, 1918.
Dr. Wickliff Rose,
International Health Board,
61 Broadway,
New York.
Dear Doctor Rose:
div1.p:
Your letter of October 2nd relative to the Barbados
report of 1916 of Guiteras, just received. I read the re-
port and looked over the case records that were sent me
from Dr. Gorgas. I returned them to his office, however.
It was a good report and the disease he investigated was
not yellow fever. That much is certain. I kept no copies.
